data: OB Gestational Hypertension and Pre-Eclampsia Postpartum (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Refer to Society of Obstetricians and Gynaecologists of Canada (SOGC) Clinical Practice Guideline Diagnosis, Evaluation and Management of the Hypertensive Disorders of Pregnancy
Patient Care
Blood Pressure
q4h while awake, for 24 hour, then reassess
Blood Pressure
once PRN, prior to antihypertensive medication administration
Blood Pressure
q1h PRN, for 3 hour, monitor BP after each elevation if SBP greater than or equal to 160 mmHg or if DBP greater than or equal to 110 mmHg
Pulse Oximetry
q4h for 24 hour, for 24 hours then reassess, notify treating provider if oxygen saturation is less than 95%
Monitor Urine Output
q4h, If urine output less than 120 mL over 4h notify provider
Fluid Restrictions
80 mL/h, Including IV fluids, Including PO intake
Medications
NIFEdipine long acting XL
30 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab-XL
60 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab-XL
30 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab-XL
60 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab-XL
labetalol
200 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
200 mg, PO, TID, drug form: tab
300 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
300 mg, PO, TID, drug form: tab
400 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab
400 mg, PO, TID, drug form: tab
methyldopa
250 mg, PO, TID, drug form: tab
Antihypertensive Therapy for Severe Hypertension
For severe hypertension, consider ordering magnesium sulfate in the OB Magnesium Sulfate Administration (Module)
NIFEdipine
5 mg, PO, once, PRN hypertension, drug form: cap
